properties.name: Mare Orientale
properties.detail: One of the lunar seas located on the western edge of the moon's near side.

properties.name: Hertzsprung
properties.detail: Lies in the northwestern fringe of the blast radius of the Mare Orientale impact basin. Noteworthy nearby craters include Michelson across the northeast rim, Vavilov across the western rim, and Lucretius to the southeast.

properties.name: Leuschner
properties.detail: located on the far side of the Moon, to the northwest of Montes Cordillera. An interesting feature associated with Leuschner is the Catena Leuschner, which is a crater chain formation.

properties.name: Oceanus Procellarum
properties.detail: The largest sea on the moon. Luna 9 and Surveyor 1 landed here. In the western part of the Ocean of Storms, the world's first hole leading underground was discovered.

properties.name: Luna 13
properties.detail: Luna 13 was launched on December 21, 1966, and successfully landed on the Moon on December 24, 1966.

properties.name: Luna 9
properties.detail: Luna 9 was designed as a lunar lander, part of the Soviet Union's Luna programme, aiming to achieve a soft landing on the Moon and transmit photographic data from the lunar surface back to Earth.

properties.name: Copernicus
properties.detail: A relatively new crater that formed 800 million years ago. Infrared measurements indicate it's made from stones containing magnesium and iron.

properties.name: Apollo 12 Landing Site
properties.detail: located in the southeastern region of Oceanus Procellarum, also known as the Ocean of Storms on the Moon.

properties.name: Apollo 14 Landing Site
properties.detail: Landed at a site in the Fra Mauro highlands. The landing site was initially meant for Apollo 13, but due to the in-flight incident experienced by that mission.

properties.name: Surveyor 6 Landing Site
properties.detail: Surveyor 6 aimed to study the feasibility of future human missions to the Moon.

properties.name: Kepler
properties.detail: Kepler exists between the Oceanus Procellarum to the west and Mare Insularum in the east.

properties.name: Mare Humorum
properties.detail: Age of Mare Humorum is about 3.9 billion years.

properties.name: Schickard
properties.detail: Schickard is a lunar impact crater distinguished by its walled plain structure, situated in the southwest sector of the Moon near the lunar limb.

properties.name: Mersenlus
properties.detail: Located to the west of Mare Humorum in the southwestern part of the Moon. Heavily worn, especially in the lower northern section.

properties.name: Mare Imbrium
properties.detail: The second-largest lunar sea after the Ocean of Storms.

properties.name: Tycho
properties.detail: A new crater formed 180 million years ago. Due to the materials covering it, its temperature drops slower than its surroundings.

properties.name: Mare Frigoris
properties.detail: Latin for Sea of Cold, is a notable lunar mare situated in the far north of the Moon. Mare Frigoris is described as a long, thin lunar sea, stretching east to west along the northern part of the Moon's disc for 1,400 km

properties.name: Plato
properties.detail: A crater located in the northern part. Within this crater, there are four more craters with a diameter of 2 kilometers each.

properties.name: Chang'e 5
properties.detail: Chang'e 5, the fifth mission in the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, aimed to collect lunar samples and return them to Earth.

properties.name: Grimaldi
properties.detail: near the western limp of the Moon
